intro: Nananthea perpusilla, commonly known as the dwarf nananthea, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and vines. The plant typically grows to a height of less than 10 centimeters, featuring delicate, opposite leaves that are usually oval in shape. Its flowers are small and clustered, often displaying shades of white and pink, and it produces small, round berries as fruit. Due to its compact size and ornamental appeal, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
